meanings.definition: Treat (wood) with a solution of copper sulfate or other chemicals to make it resistant to decay.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was kyanizing the wooden fence to protect it from rotting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to kyanize outdoor furniture to prevent it from deteriorating.
meanings.sent3: The kyanizing process turned the old chair into a superhero against decay.
meanings.sent4: She kyanized the deck, transforming it into an invincible fortress against decay.
meanings.sent5: After kyanizing the boat, it seemed to have gained eternal life against decay.

meanings.definition: The process of treating wood with a solution of copper sulfate or other chemicals to make it resistant to decay.
meanings.sent1: The kyanizing of the wooden beams was crucial for the longevity of the structure.
meanings.sent2: Many old buildings owe their preservation to the kyanizing they underwent.
meanings.sent3: The kyanizing of the fence made it the envy of all the other fences in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The kyanizing of the ship was like giving it a shield against the forces of decay.
meanings.sent5: The kyanizing of the bridge made it stand strong against the test of time.
